page.title: 13The Railway Line at Bayford
page.content: This line is part of the important {commuter line}from N. Herts into London. At peak hours trains into London stop at the station every 10 minutes. The Cuffley-Bayford-Hertford extension was built between 1918 and 1920. The boring of the tunnel was carried out by August 1915. The {Ponsbourne Tunnel}passes beneath Ponsbourne Park. Ponsbourne was the last tunnel along this line to be built by traditional methods. It has 5 ventilation shafts, and is 1\ miles long. The tunnel is one of the very few totally circular tunnels still surviving. {Bayford station}itself is situated \ mile north of the tunnel, on the road between Bayford and Brickendon.
